text:
Honestly, I don’t get the hype around chasing 15–20% CAGR in the market anymore. 📉

My landlord just gave me a live demo of what real growth looks like —
🚨 15% rent increase in just 3 months.
🚨 60% annual growth

No business model.
No investor pitch.
No performance metrics.
Just pure audacity. 🔥

If this continues, I’ll need a VC to fund my next lease.

Tired. Annoyed. Impressed. All at once. 😤

hashtag#RentHike hashtag#CAGRGoals

Only 1 step at a time.

In a world chasing fast growth, I’ve started appreciating something else:
Slow, steady, intentional growth.

Fast growth often looks glamorous —
But it can bring chaos, short-term thinking, and even arrogance.
Slow growth, on the other hand?
It builds discipline, character, and most importantly — stability.

At Code Help we’ve always chosen to be the kachua in the race. 🐢
We think. We discuss. We build. We take time.
We’ve missed some opportunities by not chasing trends — and that’s okay.

Because our focus has never been to “blow up.”
It’s been to build up — brick by brick, with the community, for the long run.

From being a course catalog →
We’re now moving towards a complete 1-stop learning platform —
for both college students and working professionals.

Live classes, structured pathways, mentorship, doubt support, and everything else a learner truly needs.

Slow growth isn’t boring.
It’s sustainable.
It’s real.

Visit codehelp: https://www.codehelp.in/

Seniors, what do you think ?

Over the last couple of years, the tech space has exploded with buzzwords — AI, blockchain, prompt engineering, and what not.

It’s great to explore these. But in the process, I see a lot of students ignoring something that still holds massive weight in interviews:

DSA.

Interviews haven’t suddenly become fancy.
DSA is still the go-to tool to assess your problem-solving skills, logic, and thinking under pressure.

So here’s my two cents — don’t overlook it.
Strengthen your fundamentals. It still matters.

🎓 If you’re just getting started, my DSA playlist on YouTube is completely free.

💥 And if you want to stay away from distractions, join our CodeHelp Supreme DSA community — live classes, weekly revisions, problem-solving, doubt support, and collective growth.

P.S. The real intent of this post was to guide you, not to market… but koi nahi, ab toh hogya 😅

Lastly — calling out to all my friends/Seniors in the industry:
What’s the current DSA trend in your company’s interview process?
Drop your experience in the comments — it’ll really help the students and switchers out here.

Let’s guide the next wave together. 🙌

🚨 Oh, and one last thing —
The 50% DISCOUNT on every Code Help course ends in the next 48 HOURS.
Visit Codehelp: https://lnkd.in/gNdHbWN7

hashtag#DSA hashtag#CodeHelp

We all dream of a better life —
🏡 A home we own
🚗 A car we earned
❤️ A partner we vibe with
🌱 some acres of land, 😅 maybe…

If you come from a lower middle class background like me — I just want to say:

You can do it.
Cut the noise.
Put your head down.
And build your dream into reality.

Short-term wins might feel good — but they don’t last.
The real good things in life take time, consistency, and silent hard work.

Make your parents proud.
That’s my **birthday gyaan** for you. 😄
Thanks for all the love and wishes today. ❤️

hashtag#BirthdayPost hashtag#LongTermThinking hashtag#CodeHelp

It’s my birthday today 🎂

I haven’t really been active on social media for the last couple of years, but today was different.
Woke up to a flooded inbox—DMs, emails, WhatsApps—so many wishes.
And honestly… it felt really special❤️

Sharing one of my favourite birthday messages here (screenshot attached).
It made me smile big time. The coding references, the thoughtfulness—loved every bit of it.

Grateful for each and every person who took a moment to wish. Thank you so much. 🙏
It truly means a lot.

That said… I’ll be needing your constant support to help me stay consistent —
on content, on sharing, and on showing up again.

Let’s rebuild the momentum together.
Big things are coming. ❤️

🚀 11 Lakh+ Code Submissions Requests in Just 2.5 Months.
📈 99.99% Success Rate.

This isn’t just a number—it’s a testament to the effort, sleepless nights, and engineering grit that went into building a system that scales for lakhs of learners.

As a Software Engineer, I’ve worked on high-impact projects at Amazon and Microsoft.
That felt good.

But this—this feels great.

Because now, me and my team are building our own product—Code Help—and watching it touch lives, empower students, and make quality tech education affordable and accessible.

Yes, the industry has seen a lot of ups and downs.
Yes, creators and brands keep switching lanes.
But we’ve stayed grounded.
Still #1 in affordability.
Still #1 in Hindi DSA education.
And the social media feedback speaks for itself.

We’re not just building a platform.
We’re building a movement.
Thank you for being a part of it. ❤️

hashtag#CodeHelp hashtag#Engineering hashtag#DSA hashtag#TechEducation hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#BuiltInIndia hashtag#LoveBabbar

Somebody said in a video,

so that we can take you forward 😉

Made for students with no Noise & marketing gimmicks,
Just pure technology ❤️

Early Bird Offer ends in next 48 hrs🔥

Months ago, my whole team left leaving me & lakshay with just 1 intern named Kuldeep.

We were working hard on Code Help RED and everything was going smooth until one by one, team members left (for their personal reasons, placements, job commitments etc.)

Finally, me and Lakshay started coding ourselves with Kuldeep Saini who worked day & night to build & ship this product.

Finally we gave him a full time offer with a salary of 6x of his stipend.
He is one of the most brilliant developers I have seen & delivers 10x truly!
Feel free to send Kuldeep Saini, a Hi / Thanks message.
